intro: Cylista lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Cylista, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Cylista lancifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
